hero.tagline: GNSS-DENIED NAVIGATION // CRYPTOGRAPHIC VALIDATION // MULTI-SENSOR CONSENSUS

problem.title: GPS IS COMPROMISED
problem.subtitle: Global navigation infrastructure under attack // Spoofing // Jamming // Denial of service

attack1.title: GPS SPOOFING ATTACKS
attack1.desc: Malicious actors transmit fake GPS signals, forcing drones and vehicles to follow false positions. Defense systems compromised, civilian infrastructure vulnerable.

attack2.title: SIGNAL JAMMING
attack2.desc: RF interference blocks GPS reception in contested zones. No position data, no navigation, mission failure. Urban canyons, tunnels, indoor operations - GPS unreliable.

solution.subtitle: 6 independent sensors validate position through cryptographic consensus. No GPS required. Passive. Unjammable. Unspoofable.

scenarios.title: 7 SCENARIOS
scenarios.subtitle: VALIDATED
scenarios.nominal_desc: All sensors operational, GPS available. System validates position through multi-sensor consensus with cryptographic integrity verification.
scenarios.drift100_desc: Simulated GPS drift of 100 meters. System detects anomaly through sensor disagreement and maintains accurate position via celestial navigation.
scenarios.drift500_desc: Severe GPS drift of 500 meters. Integrity score drops significantly. System flags GPS as unreliable and switches to backup sensors.
scenarios.spoofing_desc: Active spoofing attack detected. Cryptographic validation fails. System rejects GPS data entirely and operates in GNSS-denied mode.
scenarios.night_desc: Sun sensor unavailable. Star tracker and magnetometer provide primary navigation. System maintains 98% integrity through sensor redundancy.
scenarios.multisensor_desc: All 6 sensors contribute to position solution. Extended Kalman Filter fuses data with optimal weighting based on sensor confidence.
scenarios.consensus_desc: Cryptographic hash comparison across all sensor outputs. Hamming distance calculation ensures data integrity. Byzantine fault tolerance achieved.

ip.title: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
ip.subtitle: Strong patent portfolio protecting core innovations
ip.patent1_desc: Novel ESKF implementation for celestial navigation with cryptographic validation
ip.patent2_desc: Distributed sensor agreement mechanism with Byzantine fault tolerance
